alert.note: Alert for Humphreys; Issaquena; Sharkey; Washington; Yazoo (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern East Carroll Parish, southeastern Washington, Yazoo, northern Issaquena, southwestern Humphreys and Sharkey Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 313 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Louise to Anguilla to near Glen Allan. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Louise and Midnight around 320 PM CDT. Holly Bluff around 335 PM CDT. Yazoo City and Cary around 340 PM CDT. Onward and Tinsley around 350 PM CDT. Little Yazoo around 355 PM CDT. Bentonia, Satartia and Myrleville around 400 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
